javascriptCourse.title: Basic Output
Variables (var, let, const)
Data Types
javascriptCourse.code:
let str = "Hello";       // String
let num = 123;           // Number
let isActive = true;     // Boolean
let value = null;        // Null
let data;                // Undefined
let person = { name: "Alice", age: 25 }; // Object
console.log(str,num,isActive,value,data,person)

javascriptCourse.title: Operators
javascriptCourse.code:
let x = 10 + 5;     // Arithmetic
let y = x > 5;         // Comparison
let z = true && false; // Logical
console.log(x,y,z)

javascriptCourse.title: Functions

javascriptCourse.code:

console.log(add(2, 3));

javascriptCourse.title: Conditional Statements

javascriptCourse.code:

<script>
function sayHello() {
  alert("Hello from button!");
}
</script>

javascriptCourse.title: DOM Manipulation
javascriptCourse.code: Original Text

javascriptCourse.title: Form Validation
javascriptCourse.code:
<form onsubmit="return validateForm()">
  <input type="text" id="username">
  <input type="submit">
</form>

<script>
function validateForm() {
  let name = document.getElementById("username").value;
  if (name === "") {
    alert("Name is required");
    return false;
  }
  return true;
}
</script>

awsCourse.title: What is AWS?
awsCourse.code:
AWS (Amazon Web Services) is a cloud platform offering services like:
- EC2 (Compute)
- S3 (Storage)
- RDS (Databases)
- Lambda (Serverless)
- IAM (Access Management)

awsCourse.title: Set Up AWS CLI
S3 – Create a Bucket
awsCourse.code:
aws s3 mb s3://my-bucket-name
// "mb" means Make Bucket

awsCourse.title: S3 – Upload/Download Files
awsCourse.code:
aws s3 cp file.txt s3://my-bucket-name/
aws s3 cp s3://my-bucket-name/file.txt ./

awsCourse.title: S3 – List & Delete
awsCourse.code:
aws s3 ls s3://my-bucket-name/
aws s3 rm s3://my-bucket-name/file.txt

awsCourse.title: Launch EC2 Instance
awsCourse.code:
// Using AWS Console OR CLI
aws ec2 run-instances --image-id ami-xyz --count 1 --instance-type t2.micro --key-name my-key --security-groups my-sg

awsCourse.title: Connect to EC2 via SSH
awsCourse.code: ssh -i my-key.pem ec2-user@your-ec2-public-ip

awsCourse.title: Stop/Start/Terminate EC2
awsCourse.code:
aws ec2 stop-instances --instance-ids i-1234567890
aws ec2 start-instances --instance-ids i-1234567890
aws ec2 terminate-instances --instance-ids i-1234567890

awsCourse.title: IAM – Create a User
awsCourse.code:
// IAM > Users > Add user (Programmatic access)
// Attach policies like AmazonS3FullAccess

awsCourse.title: IAM – Roles & Policies
Lambda – Create Function
awsCourse.code:
// Console or CLI
aws lambda create-function --function-name helloLambda --runtime nodejs18.x --handler index.handler --role <IAM-role-arn>

awsCourse.title: Lambda – Sample Code
CloudWatch – Logs & Alarms
RDS – Launch Database
awsCourse.code:
// Console or CLI (MySQL/Postgres)
aws rds create-db-instance --db-instance-identifier mydb --db-instance-class db.t2.micro --engine mysql --master-username admin --master-user-password pass1234

awsCourse.title: Elastic Beanstalk – Deploy App
awsCourse.code:
eb init
eb create my-env
eb deploy

awsCourse.title: CloudFront – CDN Setup
awsCourse.code:
// Distribute S3 static site or web app
aws cloudfront create-distribution --origin-domain-name my-bucket.s3.amazonaws.com
